DFG question content: How does your project generate new data?
The most similar question in Horzon Euro: What types and formats of data will the project generate or re-use?
The second most similar question in Horz: What is the purpose of the data generation or re-use and its relation to the objectives of the project?

The most similar question in Horzon Euro: What is the origin/provenance of the data, either generated or re-used?
The second most similar question in Horz: What types and formats of data will the project generate or re-use?

DFG question content: Which data types (in terms of data formats like image data, text data or measurement data) arise in your project and in what way are they further processed? To what extent do these arise or what is the anticipated data volume?
The most similar question in Horzon Euro: What types and formats of data will the project generate or re-use?
The second most similar question in Horz: What is the expected size of the data that you intend to generate or re-use?

DFG question content: What approaches are being taken to describe the data in a comprehensible manner (such as the use of available metadata, documentation standards or ontologies)?
The most similar question in Horzon Euro: What data and metadata vocabularies, standards, formats or methodologies will you follow to make your data interoperable to allow data exchange and re-use within and across disciplines?
The second most similar question in Horz: Will rich metadata be provided to allow discovery? What metadata will be created? What disciplinary or general standards will be followed? In case metadata standards do not exist in your discipline, please outline what type of metadata will be created and how.

DFG question content: What measures are being adopted to ensure high data quality? Are quality controls in place and if so, how do they operate?
The most similar question in Horzon Euro: Will the provenance of the data be thoroughly documented using the appropriate standards?
The second most similar question in Horz: What provisions are or will be in place for data security (including data recovery as well as secure storage/archiving and transfer of sensitive data)?

DFG question content: Which digital methods and tools (e.g. software) are required to use the data?
The most similar question in Horzon Euro: Will documentation or reference about any software be needed to access or read the data be included?
The second most similar question in Horz: What types and formats of data will the project generate or re-use?

DFG question content: How is the data to be stored and archived throughout the project duration?
The most similar question in Horzon Euro: How will long term preservation be ensured? Discuss the necessary resources to accomplish this (costs and potential value, who decides and how, what data will be kept and for how long)?
The second most similar question in Horz: Will the data be safely stored in trusted repositories for long term preservation and curation?

DFG question content: What is in place to secure sensitive data throughout the project duration (access and usage rights)?
The most similar question in Horzon Euro: What provisions are or will be in place for data security (including data recovery as well as secure storage/archiving and transfer of sensitive data)?
The second most similar question in Horz: If there are restrictions on use, how will access be provided to the data, both during and after the end of the project?

DFG question content: What are the legal specifics associated with the handling of research data in your project?
The most similar question in Horzon Euro: Will all data be made openly available? If certain datasets cannot be shared (or need to be shared under restricted access conditions), explain why, clearly separating legal and contractual reasons from intentional restrictions. Note that in multi-beneficiary projects it is also possible for specific beneficiaries to keep their data closed if opening their data goes against their legitimate interests or other constraints as per the Grant Agreement.
The second most similar question in Horz: Will your data include qualified references  to other data (e.g. other data from your project, or datasets from previous research)?

DFG question content: Do you anticipate any implications or restrictions regarding subsequent publication or accessibility?
The most similar question in Horzon Euro: If there are restrictions on use, how will access be provided to the data, both during and after the end of the project?
The second most similar question in Horz: If an embargo is applied to give time to publish or seek protection of the intellectual property (e.g. patents), specify why and how long this will apply, bearing in mind that research data should be made available as soon as possible.

DFG question content: What is in place to consider aspects of use and copyright law as well as ownership issues?
The most similar question in Horzon Euro: Will metadata be made openly available and licenced under a public domain dedication CC0, as per the Grant Agreement? If not, please clarify why. Will metadata contain information to enable the user to access the data?
The second most similar question in Horz: Will your data be licensed using standard reuse licenses, in line with the obligations set out in the Grant Agreement?

DFG question content: Are there any significant research codes or professional standards to be taken into account?
The most similar question in Horzon Euro: Will your data include qualified references  to other data (e.g. other data from your project, or datasets from previous research)?
The second most similar question in Horz: Will the provenance of the data be thoroughly documented using the appropriate standards?

DFG question content: Which data sets are especially suitable for use in other contexts?
The most similar question in Horzon Euro: Will your data include qualified references  to other data (e.g. other data from your project, or datasets from previous research)?
The second most similar question in Horz: Do you, or will you, make use of other national/funder/sectorial/departmental procedures for data management? If yes, which ones (please list and briefly describe them)?

DFG question content: Which criteria are used to select research data to make it available for subsequent use by others?
The most similar question in Horzon Euro: Will your data include qualified references  to other data (e.g. other data from your project, or datasets from previous research)?
The second most similar question in Horz: Beneficiaries should consider which of the questions pertaining to FAIR data above, can apply to the management of other research outputs, and should strive to provide sufficient detail on how their research outputs will be managed and shared, or made available for re-use, in line with the FAIR principles.

DFG question content: Are you planning to archive your data in a suitable infrastructure? If so, how and where? Are there any retention periods?
The most similar question in Horzon Euro: Will the data be safely stored in trusted repositories for long term preservation and curation?
The second most similar question in Horz: Have you explored appropriate arrangements with the identified repository where your data will be deposited?

DFG question content: When is the research data available for use by third parties?
The most similar question in Horzon Euro: Will your data be made freely available in the public domain to permit the widest re-use possible?
The second most similar question in Horz: Will the data produced in the project be useable by third parties, in particular after the end of the project?

DFG question content: Who is responsible for adequate handling of the research data (description of roles and responsibilities within the project)?
The most similar question in Horzon Euro: Who will be responsible for data management in your project?
The second most similar question in Horz: Beneficiaries should consider which of the questions pertaining to FAIR data above, can apply to the management of other research outputs, and should strive to provide sufficient detail on how their research outputs will be managed and shared, or made available for re-use, in line with the FAIR principles.

DFG question content: Which resources (costs; time or other) are required to implement adequate handling of research data within the project?
The most similar question in Horzon Euro: What will the costs be for making data or other research outputs FAIR in your project (e.g. direct and indirect costs related to storage, archiving, re-use, security, etc.) ?
The second most similar question in Horz: How will long term preservation be ensured? Discuss the necessary resources to accomplish this (costs and potential value, who decides and how, what data will be kept and for how long)?

DFG question content: Who is responsible for curating the data once the project has ended?
The most similar question in Horzon Euro: Will the data produced in the project be useable by third parties, in particular after the end of the project?
The second most similar question in Horz: If there are restrictions on use, how will access be provided to the data, both during and after the end of the project?
